snippet: Harlem parents have been expressing frustration at the still limited number of high-quality choices in the city’s push to add charter schools in the neighborhood.
abstract: Harlem parents, in interviews, express frustration at the still-limited number of high-quality choices in the city's push to add charter schools to the neighborhood; charter schools have been an important element of Michael R Bloomberg's education agenda, but the majority of Harlem students have not been able to get in to the few high-performing schools in the area.

byline.contributor: Theodoric Meyer and Anna M. Phillips contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Harlem parents have been expressing frustration at the still limited number of high-quality choices in the city’s push to add charter schools in the neighborhood.

headline.seo: New Charter Schools Thrive in Harlem, but Some Parents Are Feeling Left Out
headline.main: School Choice Is No Cure-All, Harlem Finds
headline.print_headline: School Choice Is No Cure-All, Harlem Finds
